definition: lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk

sentences.english: Ichthyosaurs and other contemporary viviparous species, by contrast, gave birth to multiple offspring.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，魚龍和其他現代胎生的物種產下多個幼崽。

sentences.english: Hongyan Chang Fei-ray, fish and dragons written submersible water jump.
sentences.chinese: 鴻雁長飛光不度，魚龍潛躍水成文。

sentences.english: Entire skeletons of ancient creatures including predators like the saurichthys, pictured, were discovered
sentences.chinese: 完整的古代食肉動物魚龍化石被發現，有圖有真相。

sentences.english: Given these factors, some areas have become a treasury of well-preserved ichthyosaur fossils.
sentences.chinese: 由於這些原因，很多地區都很好的保存了魚龍的化石。

sentences.english: Cymbospondylus had no dorsal fin and its tail was long like an eel's.
sentences.chinese: 杯椎魚龍沒有背鰭，尾部像鰻魚一樣扁長。

sentences.english: At present Chinese innovation is a mixed bag.
sentences.chinese: 目前中國的創新“魚龍混雜”。

sentences.english: The dragons and fishes jumbled together - the good and bad people were mixed together.
sentences.chinese: 《魚龍混雜》是比喻壞人和好人混在一起。

definition: Milky Way/also called 銀河|银河[Yin2 he2]
a beautiful woman/graceful and elegant posture/moon
sinuous/meandering/to take a circuitous route/to toss about/vicissitudes/variant of 婉轉|婉转[wan3 zhuan3]
Baqiao District of Xi’an 西安市[Xi1 an1 Shi4], Shaanxi
(literary) crisscross/uneven/disorderly/rim of the eye/variant of 欄杆|栏杆[lan2 gan1]
border fort, esp. defending narrow valley
to inspect one by one/to list individually
infantile convulsion (illness affecting children esp. under the age of five, marked by muscular spasms)
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
